text: Sydney Irwin Pollack (July 1, 1934 â€“ May 26, 2008) was an American movie and television director, producer and actor. Pollack was born in Lafayette, Indiana. During his childhood he moved to South Bend, Indiana. He moved to New York City when he was 17. He won an Emmy Award in 1966. He won two Academy Awards and a Golden Globe Award for 1985 movie Out of Africa. He died of cancer of unknown primary origin in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles, California. == Other websites == * Category:1934 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Academy Award winning directors Category:Actors from South Bend, Indiana Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American television directors Category:American television producers Category:American voice actors Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:Deaths from cancer of unknown primary origin Category:Emmy Award winning directors Category:Jewish American actors Category:Movie directors from Indiana Category:Movie producers from Indiana
title: Sydney Pollack
